Selected Answer: AC
The Prompts "AAWelcome.wav" length is 0 bytes. hence, the option A is correct. and for option C change the welcome prompt setting also the solouation.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A collaboration engineer is troubleshooting Cisco Unity Express integrated with Cisco UCME. Internal users and external callers report that calls to the auto-attendant are answered, but that greeting is not being played. Which two actions must the engineer take to resolve the issue? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Increase the number of sessions on the aa2 application.
choices.E: Change the language setting on the prompt.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
from the course-LAB "Configure Calling Numer-Based Routing" answer A is correct. The question says "Which action should be taken to correct thie issue" and from the screenshot A is the answer

Selected Answer: D
should be D

choices.B: Modify the Call Forward All to the voicemail pilot.
choices.C: Modify the Dialed Number condition from “Equals” to “In”.
choices.D: Modify the rule to a Forward Routing Rule.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A collaboration engineer restored a failed primary node of an active/standby IM and Presence subcluster. The engineer notices that user fallback to the primary node has not occurred. Which action resolves this issue?

choices.D: Wait for the primary node to establish 30 minutes of uptime.

questions.question_text: The persistent chat feature is configured in a Cisco Jabber deployment that is running Cisco Unified IM and Presence 11.5 SU6. Desktop clients are working, but mobile clients are not displaying persistent chats. Which configuration is necessary to enable the Jabber persistent chat feature on mobile devices?

choices.D: while logged into IM and Presence server Administration, go to "Messaging", then "Settings", and check the checkbox for the "Enable persistent chat for mobile" field
choices.A: add the true line to the Jabber configuration file that is used by mobile devices
choices.C: add the false line to the Jabber configuration file that is used by all Jabber devices
choices.B: add "Enable_Persistent_Chat" in the "Cisco Support Field" on the Jabber for mobile device configuration page on Cisco UCM

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Between B and C I would choose C

Selected Answer: B
I am inclined to agree with daniel_tang
Errors for A and D should look different (https://www.ietf.org/archive/id/draft-ietf-xmpp-3920bis-00.html)
That leaves B or C
out of the two and looking at RFC 3921 B seems to be more likely

Selected Answer: B
Maybe the option B is correct
please refer to page 11, If the username or resource is not allowed to create a session, the
 server MUST return an error (e.g., forbidden).
If there is already an active resource of the same name, the server
 MUST either (1) terminate the active resource and allow the
 newly-requested session, or (2) disallow the newly-requested session
 and maintain the active resource. Which of these the server does is
 up to the implementation, although it is RECOMMENDED to implement
 case #1. In case #1, the server SHOULD send a <conflict/> stream
 error to the active resource, terminate the XML stream and underlying
 TCP connection for the active resource, and return a IQ stanza of
 type "result" (indicating success) to the newly-requested session.
https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3921.txt

choices.A: The user credentials are incorrect; ask the user to change the credentials.
choices.C: Presence has stopped working for the user; unassign and reassign the end-user to Cisco IM and Presence.
choices.D: The Cisco IM and Presence Server has CPU/memory issues; restart the IM and Presence Server.
choices.B: The user is duplicated in another Cisco IM and Presence cluster; unassign the user from the duplicate IM and Presence cluster.
